title.narrative: EQUITY-FOCUSSED AND CHILD-SENSITIVE SOCIAL PROTECTION MECHANISMS

description.narrative: By 2020, public institutions and decentralised entities in the targeted regions have the capacity to implement national and local mechanisms for equity-focussed and child-sensitive social protection.

mailing-address.narrative: Winston Churchill Avenue P.O. Box 1181 Yaoundé

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, public institutions and decentralised entities in the targeted regions have the capacity to implement national and local mechanisms for equity-focussed and child-sensitive social protection.

description.narrative: Partnerships with Government, development partners, and the UN are centered around investing in system's building of child sensitive social protection that seeks to fight monetary child poverty of 44.2% together with multi-dimensional child poverty. Efforts and UNICEF interventions include support in evidence generation, central and regional planning and financing development, programme design development and administration of social protection programming to support development and humanitarian needs of children | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

2.4 Coordination: Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established countrywide
A budgeted social protection contingency plan is in place

actual.value: 2019:There is a total of 126 Communual Development Plans that have costed to include social protection mechanisms.
